title: Check the occupancy of identities or products in Shopping Ads

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

parameters.name: store_id
parameters.description: The ID of the TikTok Shop. To obtain a TikTok Shop that is available for GMV Max Campaigns, use /gmv_max/store/list/ and confirm that the returned is_gmv_max_available is true .

parameters.name: occupied_asset_type
parameters.description: The type of asset that you want to check for occupancy in enabled Video Shopping Ads, Product Shopping Ads, or Live Shopping Ads. Enum values: IDENTITY_TT_USER : TikTok User ( TT_USER ) identity. IDENTITY_BC_AUTH_TT : TikTok Account User in Business Center ( BC_AUTH_TT ) identity. IDENTITY_TTS_TT : TikTok Account User for TikTok Shop ( TTS_TT ) identity. SPU : SPU.

parameters.name: asset_ids
parameters.description: The asset IDs. Max size: 1. When occupied_asset_type is IDENTITY_TT_USER , specify one TT_USER identity ID via this field. When occupied_asset_type is IDENTITY_BC_AUTH_TT , specify one BC_AUTH_TT identity ID via this field. When occupied_asset_type is IDENTITY_TTS_TT , specify one TTS_TT identity ID via this field. When occupied_asset_type is SPU , specify the SPU ID of a product within the TikTok Shop via this field. To obtain a list of identities, use /gmv_max/identity/get/ . To obtain the list of SPU IDs for products within a TikTok Shop, use /store/product/get/ . Set ad_creation_eligible to GMV_MAX and check the returned item_group_id .

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix-Return Code .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: request_id
top_fields.description: The log ID of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.

fields.name: occupied_custom_shop_ads
fields.description: The list of enabled Shopping Ads that are currently using the assets.

fields.name: create_time
fields.description: The time when the ad group or ad was created, in the format of YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC+0). When campaign_id and adgroup_id are returned, this field represents the time when the ad group was created. When adgroup_id and ad_id are returned, this field represents the time when the ad was created.
